intro: Phacelia magellanica f. robusta, commonly known as the Magellan phacelia, is a perennial flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has small, ovate leaves with a rough texture, and its flowers bloom in early spring. This subspecies is noted for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in cooler climates.
